features: 【Specification】Input: 120 V 50/60HZ; Output: 24 V 40VA, this 24 volt transformer is UL-certified, offers reliable performance and safe to use

【Universal compatibility】 this 24v transformer fits for Nest, Ecobee, Honeywell and Sensi smart thermostats; Also compatible with Ring Video Doorbell, Ring Video Doorbell 2, Ring Video Doorbell Pro, Nest Skybell Doorbell, and other devices that require constant 24 volt power for operation

【Power Multiple Thermostats/Doorbells】Replace and upgrade underpowered transformers with this 24V AC Transformer, while providing ample power to single or multiple thermostats and doorbells（Perfect replacement for an old transformer and will work with any wired door chime）
【Easy to Install】The doorbell transformer is easy to replace and install with screws, unscrews or threaded clips to the electrical box, in a safe place

【Customer Service】If our 24v 40va doorbell transformer fail to meet your expectations, please get in touch with us and we'll try to resolve the issue. If unresolved, you'll get a refund or replacement.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for video doorbell
reviews.reviewText: Needed a reliable upgrade transformer to power my new SimpliSafe video doorbell. This transformer works beautifully for that purpose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Using this for my sons ring doorbells
reviews.reviewText: Attached 3 ring doorbells to it. It works to power all 3.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Slightly over voltage
reviews.reviewText: Had this professionally installed by an electrician for a Eufy video doorbell (requires 8-24V). It functions great, but the measured output voltage is about 26.5V. Doesn't seem to be an issue, but hope it doesn't cause a problem down the line.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works for 2 digital chimes
reviews.reviewText: After moving into a new place, the doorbells did not work (one chime upstairs, one chime down). After attempting to replace the chimes and running into the same issue, I replaced the transformer assuming it was blown. Same size transformer didn't solve the issue, but this sure did!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solved my Low Power Issue
reviews.reviewText: My camera was reporting a low power error. This resulted in video sometimes being choppy or extremely delayed in the beginning of recording. This unit fixed the issue and feels pretty hefty. Good buy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What you need for Ring Doorbell Pro unit.
reviews.reviewText: 16v transformers are the minimum power required for My Ring Doorbell camera and these transformers run 2v under their rated voltage when i hook them up. so with the 16v i was getting 14v and sometimes 16v, with the 24v transformer I get a solid 22v so far.The doorbells operating range is between 16v-24v so it would be prudent to get the 24v so the doorbell can function properly with room for voltage fluctuation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent build quality, silent operation even under full load
reviews.reviewText: The Auspow Doorbell Transformer 24V 40VA impresses with its decent build quality. The weight of the transformer gives a sense of its robustness. The transformer operates silently even under full load, which is a positive aspect. It remains cool when there is no load, indicating efficient operation. The no-load voltage measures at 27V.For a full-load test, a 12.1 ohms power resistor was used as a load. The terminal AC voltage recorded was 23.2V. This voltage corresponds to an AC current of 1.92A. Despite the heavy load, the transformer operated quietly and remained cool during the brief seconds of the full-load test. This is a good indication that the transformer handled the load comfortably. It should be capable of powering most doorbell cameras, even when accounting for wire loss. However, it’s important to ensure that the doorbell camera can handle a 24V AC voltage. In conclusion, this product has proven to be highly satisfactory for its intended purposes.
